section.para: The dataset refers to Ground vegetation seasonal (summer-in summer-out) assessment at 4 forest CONECOFOR LTER plots.

para.literalLayout: The dataset is created according to the ICP Forests Ground Vegetation manual. The nomenclature follows the Flora Europaea (Tutin et al., 1968-1980; Tutin et al., 1993) for vascular plants and Frey et al. (1995) for bryophytes.

methodStep.instrumentation: Procedures for data validation follow the GV manual of ICP Forests. The dataset is already validated by University of Camerino the Responsible Body for data validation.

section.para: The sampling units are not contiguous; they are placed as far apart as possible within the Level II plot in order to minimize spatial correlation between the sampling units. All measures of the sampling units are taken according to the slope. To achieve a statistical representativeness, probability sampling methods are adopted (random, systematic, stratification). Location of sampling unit excludes major heterogeneities at any scale of sampling (boulders and cliffs, tracks and paths, fire places, streams and ponds, ditches and channels, peaty pools). Thus, terricolous plants growing on mineral and organic soil of the undisturbed forest floor are represented.
